comments.commentBody: I was more comfortable watching Bill Clinton's visible tension than Ivanka Trump being used as a prop.
If that was all you were watching, you have obviously missed the point of having a presidential election.

What we saw in tonight's debate was a thin-skinned pathological bully, who would only use the presidential office to wreak havoc upon all those he thinks have maligned him in any way, shape, or form.
Aside from the fact that this is a person who is unable to listen, except to his poisonous spin-doctors Steve Bannon & Roger Ailes, he has repeatedly proven that he has neither the temperament, or the diplomacy to be the 'Leader of the Free World'.
There's a significant difference between auditioning for a Reality Show, "looking presidential" -- and actually assuming the highest elective office in this land.
Small-minded vindictiveness has no place in the White House.
Donald Trump appears not to have received this memo.

The Man:

Pathologically lies yet is trustworthy to half the nation,
Assaults Women and then distracts the nation by calling the former President a rapist,
Is obsessed with Women's sexuality yet suggests no one is more respectful to Women but him,
Offers no solution yet will tear apart the one and only attempt to provide the most vulnerable with healthcare,
Has no backing from businessmen with integrity who have real success to show for yet thinks of himself as a smart businessman,
Insults a POW and then brags about the support from Generals and Admirals,
Has no moral standing whatsoever - Conservative or Liberal - yet presents himself as a unifying force who'll bring our Country together,
Get's free passes from news media yet complains how he's up against it with the journalists...
... still has a shot at leading the Country and the Free World!

America 2016.
God, I so hope you're right.

Donald Trump's comment that if he was President then he would put Hillary in jail, makes me think of one person and one person only -
Tricky Dick Nixon and his enemies list.

Frankly we've all seen that movie and I just don't think we need to see the sequel.
You're right, but we need to get past 75-year-old references.

...And so the most undignified, utterly unforgivably demeaning presidential election in history continues. How much more embarrassing can it get? How bad would you have to be to generate a GOP walkout? Some of those guys don't even know what century it is or what country they're living in, nor do they care, but they know they don't like that.
Except Hilary Clinton's campaign did not bring up the video. That was the Washington Post, which has quite the conservative editorial side.

The new low was making a promise to make an apparently politically motivated police investigation. A very esteemed FBI investigated already did the work and recommended against prosecution or further action. The deal is done, except in the minds of the the deplorably mentally incompetent.

There is no point in whining about Trump's own words, quoted in context, being used against him. If he cannot stand the heat, get out of the kitchen.
I can only imagine what it is like to be a woman on a stage stalked by that awful hulking creep.

I know foreign policy may seem boring amidst Trump's bragging about sexual assault and acting like he is coked out of his mind, but did he really say he and Pence have not talked about Syria so they disagree?

A Presidential candidate who has not talked to his running mate about one of the top foreign policy issues of the election by October is not serious about doing the job. What do they talk about? Grabbing women? You need no further proof that Trump is not serious about the job. He is treating the whole thing as a hustle, and the whole country as the sucker.

Yes. Trump really did say that he and Mr. Pence have not talked about Syria...and probably a lot of other things as well.
No big surprise there since he knows it all....and of course, better.
I hope that "Grope a Dope" is not what you really mean. You're calling the person being groped -- not the groper -- a dope.

It seems to me Christine you saw a different debate than most of us.

At no time did Hillary appear "intimidated" by Trump or "robotic" when answering questions from the audience.

But, I guess you think Hillary should have acted like Trump and stalked around the stage with a crazy look of anger or got into a shouting match when Trump hurled all of his lies at her.

I, for one, want a president that conducts themselves as an adult, not as a emotionally-stunted frat house boy, which is something that Hillary had an abundance of tonight.

Please. What kind of woman would live for decades with a husband who has been chasing skirts, was caught at it, lied about it, denied it? I ask you. Any self respecting woman would have thrown that bum out years ago. And those who don't? Then I'd say they are fine fodder for a session or more on a shrink's couch.
Trump's potty mouth could never match up with Bill Clinton's known deeds. As someone once asked "why is it when Clinton had a relationship with Lewinsky, then lied about it, the media said his personal life didn't affect his public life? Why is this different for Trump?" Difference is because Clinton is a Democrat and Trump is not.
And why not one woman talking about rape and coercion on the part of both Clintons? He raped and she coerced. Don't say Bill isn't on the ballot, friends. He's the elephant sitting in the corner of the room or more succinctly, the buzzard circling the sky.
Liberals want everyone to be tolerant but the very second you ask the same of them - "how dare you! Don't you know we are right and you are wrong?" That's it in a nutshell.

You conservatives have a curious moral compass. You have one candidate who has been married three times and even "dated" his next wife while still married to his previous wife. The other candidate has never strayed from her marriage and has done everything she could to preserve her marriage. Your candidate is out  trying to score on a married  woman with a pregnant wife at home. But none of that bothers you ??? Outrageous!

There have been numerous reliable reports that Donald is a sexual predator and sociopath.  Even disregarding this he is an ignoramus on national and international issues and have the critical thinking skills  of a 7 year old.   His blabbering on why does the US military announce when they are going to do this or that is a prime example of this;  there are many reasons why our military makes military operational announcements; a lot of times it's reverse psychology to our enemies; yet  General Trump does not even have the mental skills to think more than one step ahead of anything.   He thinks everything is a hollywood movie and should be able to be resolved within two hours.
Bill is not on the ballot, my friend.
"That's not fair-she's had one more minute [than me]".

Trump 40:10
Clinton 39:05

He had 1:05 more than her.

@Donna
That's called rules, Donna. Something that Hillary and her supporters don't think applies to her, but only to the little people -- that is, in Hillary speak, only to the deplorables and basement dwellers.

If you think harassing and assaulting women, by groping them or forcefully holding their genitalia, is "just locker room banter" (while providing details that either reflects knowledge from action or a screwed up fantasy) is "sanity. civility or following rules"...you need your brain checked. Men like him are deplorable, and those who support him, with no attention to what he stands for (which is nothing other than bombast) or rationalizing his sexism and misogyny, are deplorable too. You are okay with him evading taxes for years and years (where is the following-rule in that?), you are okay with how he stiffed his contractors (where is following-rule in that?) and how he has cheated Trump University students (where is following-rule in that)?

You have the right to criticize Ms Clinton...but your argument about her breaking a rule, while he broke many many more, is stupid, contradictory and cheap. More typical of a businessman, minority or otherwise, having something to hide. Colonized minds are not very good at critical thinking.

Is there even a comparison?  Clinton clearly wins both on substance and style, though she was visibly tense at the beginning. Trump looked like a clown. I am not sure if there was any single question that Trump actually answered. He dodges questions, changes topics, blames her for everything, does not stay on topic. He is exactly what he said about her: he is just talk, and completely incoherent.  He is just repeating the same general phrases over and over again, just in different order. There is no substance in his talk, and his ignorance is just, well, tremendous.

It's men like Trump.  He claims to sexually assault women, who "let" him do it because he's famous.  More likely, they're terrified.  Terrified to speak up -- because if they do, they'll be crucified.  Even though they are the victims.  The common defense of assailants is:  Attack the victims, again, this time in court, in the popular press, in the social media.  And no, I don't condone what Mr. Clinton stands accused of -- but there is a difference.  It's not a matter of bias.
Can't wait until the Apprentice tapes are released.

So let's see, Trump lied repeatedly, said blatant untruths, interrupted with smartass answers, was crass and often simply a bully. On the other hand Clinton  talked about the issues and brought up Trump's own disgusting words. Yet we have headlines that have a false equivalency talking about a "nasty debate" etc. I'm sorry, but I saw Trump nasty, I didn't see it the other way around.

Bill Clinton passed into the background a long time ago. She isn't going to take orders from Bill Clinton given her background and experience. He certainly will be a confidant and advisor---and as far as an influence on national policy, he is still one of the best in the business in reading the public's take on national policies.

Trump is NASTINESS, itself. That is all he is, angry, mad, mean, bullying, threatening, etc. There is not substance, just hate and fear.

Is that what we want for the next four years? I don't think the American people could stand it.

I hope that Clinton will use Trump's nastiness in her ads to frighten voters away from Trump...He is like a Halloween monster!

The only thing we have to fear is Donald (Nasty) Trump.
---------------------------------------------------------------------
He reminds me of the unpleasant trend for so called clowns stalking the US - and the world. Both a clown and evil with it.

The only thing we have to really fear in the next four years is the open-borders policy of President Obama being continued.  "Diversity is a strength"  is the biggest lie the government has ever told us. Unlimited illegal immigration from uneducated 3rd World countries with high birthrates is not a strength.
Clinton's answers were much more to the point than Trump's were. She didn't need to be pressed as much.
I meant escalator. My head is so fried after watching that I missed it.
Billy Bush gets suspended from his job just for having listened to Trump on the sex tape; and Trump is still running for President? Is there a little problem with judgment here?

To be fair, Drumpf was better tonight than in the previous debate. But look what it took to get him to prepare?

If you're an adult Republican, as opposed to an alt-Right insurrectionist, do you really trust this man to consistently pay careful attention to the countless briefings a President receives each and every day?

As to the substance of this debate, Hillary failed to make this point when Drumpf opened the door, but I will. Canada covers everyone in their country with a single payer system, while paying as much as 100% less (as a percentage of GDP) as does America, while we barely cover 90% of Americans.

Now, calculate the numbers as regards what the US spends on healthcare every year, and then divide that by two? How many Americans would accept a trade-off of having to wait a month or so extra for a hip replacement in exchange for this country saving HUNDREDS OF BILLIONS OF DOLLARS EVERY YEAR?

Imagine how stronger would our budgetary situation would be today if we had as cost-efficient a health care system as Canada.

Shouldn't conservatives who sweat every dollar prefer to save hundreds of billions a year?

Now, to change the subject, the fact checking is coming back as I type, and it turns out that Drumpf did his Pinocchio thing again tonight - and we should be thankful that while he physically cowered over Hillary most of the night, he didn't get close enough to molest her with his hugely elongated lying nose.
Do you call harassing Mrs. Clinton as being "better" than he was in the first debate. Sorry, but you are very misguided if you believe that.
By using a fake demeaning name for a person, any writer lowers the value of their message substantially.
